CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Needs Analysis stage positioned above or below the Contract Signed stage?
SRP.A: The Needs Analysis stage is positioned {above} the Contract Signed stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Needs Analysis?
VE.A: The value of stage Needs Analysis is {554}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Proposal Sent?
VE.A: The value of stage Proposal Sent is {342}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Initial Contact, with a value of {789}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Client Onboarded, with a value of {117}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Proposal Sent to stage Negotiation?
SC.A: Decreased by {102} Clients from stage Proposal Sent to stage Negotiation.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 291? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Initial Contact} stage has {789}, the {Needs Analysis} stage has {554}, the {Proposal Sent} stage has {342}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 291? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Negotiation} stage has {240}, the {Contract Signed} stage has {145}, the {Client Onboarded} stage has {117}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 131 and 448? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Proposal Sent} stage has {342}, the {Negotiation} stage has {240}, the {Contract Signed} stage has {145}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent, or from stage Proposal Sent to Negotiation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Needs Analysis} to {Proposal Sent} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Negotiation to Contract Signed, from stage Contract Signed to Client Onboarded, or from stage Proposal Sent to Negotiation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Proposal Sent} to stage {Negotiation} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Initial Contact} and {Needs Analysis} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Contract Signed} and {Client Onboarded} stages.
